page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY, BAUMBER DISTRICT
page.content: The highest point in our district is seventy metres above sea level.This point occurs where the Caistor High Street joins the Lincoln to Skegness A158 trunk road. There are two villages in our block - Baumber and Hemingby. The land is mainly agricultural grade 2 arable land, supporting seven farms. Several footpaths are shown on the O.S. map but few are usable. The River Bain runs through our block close to Hemingby. This small trout stream rises in Ludford Parva and joins the River Witham near Tattershall. Our district is on the edge of the Lincolnshire Wolds and is about twenty three miles from the east coast.
